title: Scientific Revolution Core: Copernicus to Newton
description: The foundational texts of the Scientific Revolution: Copernicus's heliocentric theory, Galileo's telescopic discoveries, Kepler's planetary laws, Newton's Principia and Opticks, Bacon's new method, and Descartes' mechanical philosophy.

keyWorks: Copernicus De Revolutionibus (1543): Heliocentric theory, launched the Scientific Revolution
Galileo Sidereus Nuncius (1610): First telescopic observations, moons of Jupiter
Kepler Tabulae Rudolphinae (1627): Planetary tables using elliptical orbits
Newton Principia (1687): Foundation of classical mechanics, universal gravitation
Bacon Novum Organum (1620): New scientific method based on induction
Descartes Discourse (1637): Methodical doubt, cogito, mechanical philosophy
researchValue: The core primary sources of the Scientific Revolution. These works overthrew Aristotelian-Ptolemaic cosmology, established mathematical physics, and created the experimental method that defines modern science.
